meanings.definition: The centimeter-gram-second unit of magnetic induction, equal to one maxwell per square centimeter.
meanings.sent1: A gauss measures magnetic strength in a specific area.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use gauss to quantify magnetic fields.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome used a gauss to attract metal objects to his garden.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a magnetic pull like a gauss, drawing everyone towards her.
meanings.sent5: The gauss reading on the device indicated a strong magnetic field nearby.

meanings.definition: A unit of magnetic flux density equal to one maxwell per square centimeter.
meanings.sent1: The gauss level was off the charts, indicating a powerful magnetic field.
meanings.sent2: The compass needle moved in response to the gauss around it.
meanings.sent3: The cat wore a tiny gauss magnet on its collar to attract metal toys.
meanings.sent4: The music had a gauss-like effect, pulling at the heartstrings of the audience.
meanings.sent5: She could feel the gauss of the magnet pulling her hand closer to the metal object.
